intro: Psychotria hirtipes, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Psychotria hirtipes is often found in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
